DOCTOR: Clever. Very clever.
NYSSA: The Daleks?
DOCTOR: Leave nothing to chance. They boosted the entrance to their Time corridor back into the past before it imploded, and we've drifted straight into it.
PTOLEM: Where are we heading?
DOCTOR: Where they wanted to make sure we headed. I'll give you two guesses.
PTOLEM: Don't tell me. 2158.
NYSSA: Earth, America, Kansas, in a field of genetically modified vegetation.
DOCTOR: Genetically modified? What are you talking about, Nyssa?
NYSSA: I've been cross-referencing Ptolem's research with the historical information in the Tardis databank.
DOCTOR: How very ingenious.
NYSSA: Doctor, I Know what destroyed the Mutant Phase creatures on Earth in the forty third century.
DOCTOR: Well done, Nyssa, but I'm afraid that may well prove academic.
PTOLEM: What's happening now?
DOCTOR: It seems the Emperor's plan has backfired a little on him, and us. The Dalek Time corridor hasn't withstood the test of time, as it were. That's the trouble with inferior technology build by megalomaniac machines.
PTOLEM: What are you talking about?
DOCTOR: It really is imploding this time.
NYSSA: With us inside it.
PTOLEM: Oh no!
GANATUS: Everything is as it should be. (chuckles) The Doctor will destroy the Mutant Phase, and this time the Daleks will never be defeated. (Dalek voice) The Doctor will obey. The Doctor must obey.

elements.text: [Part Four]
Time distortion and lots of noise.
Doctor, can't we break free?
Normality.
I don't believe it.
Are we going to make it, Doctor?
The Tardis materialises.
Er, apparently we have.
Buzzing insects, automatic gunfire.
Is this where you landed before, Doctor?
Yes. In fact, exactly the same spot.
Scanner activates.
To the atom.
Doctor, look at the scanner.
Oh dear. Turn the sound up, Nyssa.
[OC]: You see that blue box just over there?
[OC]: Yeah.
[OC]: They're hiding in there, aren't they, Nyssa?
[OC]: Oh, yes. Yes, they are. Definitely.
[OC]: I do not believe you.
Is this what happened?
Exactly what happened.
Exactly what is happening. And if you remember, Nyssa, trouble is on its way.
[OC]: It's landing. What is it?
[OC]: Er.
[OC]: Identify yourselves.
[OC]: That, Nyssa, is a Dalek.
[OC]: Identify.
[OC]: A little dented and battle-scarred, but definitely a Dalek.
[OC]: Identify!
Of course. That's how a wasp could inject its DNA into a Dalek. Look at that Dalek. Look at it.
Dented and battle-scarred.
Probably damaged by the grenade we'd heard earlier. It must have breached the Dalek's casing just enough for a wasp to crawl through.
You're saying the Mutant Phase just because one wasp managed to get inside one Dalek? It's that simple?
History sways on the simplest of pivots, Professor.
Doctor, they're, we're coming this way.
[OC]: Now, Nyssa, now!
[OC]: Do not move!
Doctor, if they come in here with us, won't that break the
The Laws of Time. Absolutely.
Beeps and boops.
What are you up to?
[OC]: All right, all right.
[OC]: Halt!
The Tardis dematerialises.
But I don't understand.
They entered their Tardis, not ours.
And our Tardis has dematerialised too.
Yes. And landed again. About five hundred or so metres er, west of our last position. Hopefully out of harm's way. All down to the Hostile Action Displacement System. Now.
Looks quiet enough out there.
I'm hoping all this means it's safe to carry out our mission, Doctor.
Safe? Well, I wouldn't go so far as to say that.
Nyssa, you said you've discovered what destroyed the Mutant Phase on Earth.
Well, Nyssa?
Yes. Traces of a particular pesticide in the soil samples Ptolem took in the forty third century.
But how do you know that this pesticide was responsible for killing the Mutant creatures?
Let me guess. Because it was the same pesticide used to kill the species of wasp which originally infected that Dalek out there.
Well done, Doctor. The Ichneumon wasp. You see, part of the intended effect of the genetic modification of those plants out there was for them to release a chemical that agitated the Ichneumon wasp.
But why would the humans want to do that?
Oh, GM crop's quite a fad for the scientific community on Earth, particularly in America.
Because, Doctor, the wasps, now more aggressive, started attacking and killing more of the caterpillars which were threatening to destroy the crop. The wasps were effectively protecting the plants.
So why did the humans create a pesticide to destroy the wasps?

Because the wasps became far too aggressive, and because they were laying more and more eggs, their numbers increased alarmingly. The Tardis historical databank shows that after the Daleks had left Earth in 2167, there were wide-spread reports of wasps swarming and actually attacking people.
You have been doing your homework.
The crisis point came on er, July the 21st 2172. I'll transfer the
information to the scanner.

[OC]: Whole town. Three thousand innocent people. Nearly five hundred wiped out by an angry swarm of Ichneumon wasps, the rest severely injured. I've just come from the Governor's office, and she has authorised the immediate use of GK50. We've got to stop those damn wasps right in their tracks.
And that's presumably what they did.
Yes. And this is the formula for GK50.
Those chemicals were present in the soil samples I took in the forty third century.
And we need them again now. Right, follow. me.
Where are you going?
Come on, time is marching ever forward, and we haven't a moment to lose.
Door opens and closes.
2: Report.
A Roboman has been killed. I found a man and a woman. They were strangely dressed. There was a blue box.
This Roboman called for assistance. I ordered them taken captive but they escaped.
2: Why did you not exterminate them?
They entered the blue box.
It was resistant to our fire power.
2: Where is this object now? Speak!
I, I, I do not, I
2: Answer!
It, it vanished.
2: Do you concur with this Roboman's report?
I concur.
2: Unacceptable. Roboman will report immediately for reconditioning. Move.
I obey.
Footsteps. Door opens.
2: You have sustained damage. Explain yourself.
Freedom fighters ambushed my patrol
2: You will report for cell donation, full diagnostic testing and repairs to your casing.
I obey.
Doctor, where are you taking us?
Of course. We're heading for the Tardis's laboratory, aren't we?
That's right.
You want us to synthesise the GK50 pesticide.
Think you're up to the task?
Well, I, I think so.

You'd better be, because it's our only chance of stopping the Mutation in that Dalek from progressing. I have to modify my hand-held tracker to detect that Dalek's new DNA signature. It's vital we find it. With luck, it should stand out like a sore thumb. In here.
Door opens.
You'd better get started, Nyssa. Ptolem, you help her.
But Doctor, how can we be sure this pesticide will reverse the Mutant Phase at this early stage of its incubation?
We can't be sure.
What!

Just as we can't really be sure that I'm right about it being that particular Dalek, or that it isn't halfway to the Moon by now in a flying saucer, or that the GK50 may just kill the Dalek. Nothing is ever certain, Professor, but we're wrapped up in a damaged spatio-temporal causal nexus point, which means we've got to try.
We should just find that Dalek and kill it. Why waste time on this pesticide?
Please, Professor Ptolem! I'd rather not risk peripheral damage to the Time line.
Peripheral damage?
You mean that Dalek might have some historical significance beyond the Mutant Phase?
Yes, it might. Who knows? It's possible it will go on to be responsible for the death of someone. If we kill that Dalek and that someone lives
And that someone changes history.
I see. My God, Doctor. It's a mine field.
So we must tread very carefully.
And get a move on.
Precisely. Meet me in the console room as soon as you can. Every moment we delay, that Dalek is getting further and further away from us.
Reporting for repairs to outer casing.
3: Move into the remoulding bay immediately.
I obey.
Yes. Ah ha. If I can just
Ah. Ah, hello.
Ganatus.
What's happening, Doctor? Where's Ptolem.
Feeling better?
Yes, thank you. Do you know what happened to me?
No. Do you?
No. I remember Skaro exploding, then, then
You collapsed. And in answer to your earlier question, Ptolem is helping Nyssa synthesise a pesticide which will hopefully be injected into a damaged Dalek which is already carrying the Mutant Phase.
I see. How are you going to do that?
I haven't the faintest idea. Not yet, anyway.
Er, well, can I help?
Not just yet. Yes, that should do it. Now then.
Why are you looking at me like that?
You're a bit of a mystery to me, Ganatus.
I am?
I can't think of a single reason in the whole universe why you collapsed.
Well, I'm with you on that. Neither can I.
Neither can I think of why you were right about the Dalek Emperor destroying Skaro.
I'm afraid I don't follow.
Hmm. Ever heard the story of the scorpion and the frog?
The? No.
No, perhaps you haven't.
Doctor, we've managed to synthesise the GK50, and I've rigged up this injection probe.
Oh, Ganatus, how are you feeling?
He's much better, aren't you.
Er, yes, yes, I am.
Time distort.
Oh no.
Doctor, Ptolem and Ganatus, they're frozen, like statues, phasing in and out of existence. What's going on?
I'm not sure, but I've got a few nasty theories.
But you're not going to tell me what they are, are you.
The cogs of a great machine, locked together, turning in opposite directions. Time and Space crushing each other to death like brainless beasts unleashed.
Doctor, what do you mean? Tell me.
It's getting worse, Nyssa.
The paradox? The Time paradox?
Yes. There are good and bad places to have them. This is a bad place. Just bad luck in the game of universal dice, really, but if we don't do something, everything could unravel.
Everything?

Everything. Almost too large a concept to have any meaning, isn't it? Can you imagine the chaos in every particle of matter accelerating to the point of destruction? And even destruction is too small a word. Terror, agony, they don't even come close.
So if we don't stop the Mutant Phase
I'm not even sure that's what we've got to do now.
You mean you don't know what's caused the Time paradox?

I thought the nexus point was when the Dalek was stung by the wasp, and we had caused that by bouncing off the Dalek Time corridor, landing here and accidentally drawing that damaged Dalek into an area where a wasp could get inside its casing, when the seeds of the Mutant Phase were sown, as it were.
But what's made you change your mind?
Ganatus.
Distort ends.
Yes, Doctor?
The Time distortion's stopped.
Time distortion? When?
We were outside Time, Nyssa, looking in on the impending disaster.
Why?
Be careful, Nyssa. I wouldn't drop that injection probe if I were you. Here
Nyssa! No, don't let him take it.
Take this? And why not, hmm? An ingenious piece of work, Nyssa. I take it one simply holds the grip, inserts the probe into the damaged Dalek's casing and
Ganatus, what are you doing? Let him go.
Doctor!
I take it the contents of this probe would be lethal to the Doctor if I injected even the smallest amount into his neck.
I wouldn't advise you to try it.
I'm sure you wouldn't.
Ganatus, I don't understand. Why?
And you thought you were the one with the terrible secret. Well,
whatever it is, it doesn't matter now. Nyssa, open the external doors. The Doctor and I have an appointment with destiny. To make the Daleks invincible.
Doctor!
You will obey.
That voice. That's how you knew the Emperor's plans.
Their minds must be linked somehow.
But the Emperor was killed when Skaro was destroyed. How can there be a link?
I am the Emperor. Do you think I would permit a Thal scientist, no matter how brilliant, no matter how well-intentioned, to work unobserved?
You? You've been at my side all these years, Ganatus.
Watching your every move.
I thought you were my friend.
I retain all relevant information from Ganatus, but my mind is now a perfect copy of the Emperor's consciousness. His final act on Skaro was to transmit the signal for total transference of thought.
Because you couldn't trust me to carry out your mission for you. You couldn't trust me, you couldn't trust Ptolem. You have a problem with trust, don't you. Typical Dalek neuroses.
The door, Nyssa, or I kill the Doctor now.
Tardis door opens.
Thank you. Do not follow us.
Doctor!
Stay in the Tardis, Nyssa.
3: Remoulding of your outer casing complete. Communication from Dalek Command indicates that you have made erroneous reports and may be experiencing perceptual difficulties.
Understood.
3: You will now move into the diagnostic scanning bay for analysis of your internal systems.
I obey.
Wasps buzzing.
Isn't it enough that we're here to stop the Mutant Phase, to save the Dalek race of the future? What do you hope to achieve by this?
Total Dalek victory, naturally.
Oh.
Keep moving, Doctor. We cannot afford to waste time.
No, I think I'll just sit here and enjoy the view.
Get up.
Or you'll exterminate me, is that it? Exterminate me by pumping me full of GK50O, is that the plan? But I think you need me alive.
Get up.
And I don't think I'll be needing this after all.
What are you doing?
Destroying the tracker. Now how are you going to find the infected Dalek?
You would risk the future?
Looks like it. Would you, I wonder?
No sign of them. They're out of scanner range. Ptolem, what are you doing?
What we should have planned to do in the first place.
I saw that capsule in your case before. What is it?

An insurance policy, Nyssa. Something I developed little by little during my years working for the Daleks. It's raw, untested, perhaps with dangerous side-effects. I had hoped to be more confident of its effectiveness, but I'm almost certain it will work.
Almost? You might as well tell me what it is.
A genetic retrovirus, designed to destroy the Daleks.
Why didn't you use it when you were on Skaro?

Because my initial findings indicated it wouldn't work on the Mutated Daleks. But the Daleks in this time zone have not been exposed to the Mutant Phase. All I have to do is step outside the Tardis, break the capsule, and from this moment the destruction of the Daleks will begin. In two generations, they will have died out completely.
Ptolem, you can't do it.
And why not? If it works, I'll not only have rid the universe of the Mutant Phase

You don't understand. There are powerful forces at play here. Forces that hold the universe together. I don't understand it myself, but from the little the Doctor's told me, our interference in the time line at this point is dangerous enough as it is. If you try to alter history in any other way, it
What? What will happen? Millions of worlds will be free from the menace of the Daleks. Is that such a bad aim?
No. No, it isn't. But we can't take the risk with
Why not, Nyssa? Why not.
Whooshes.
Ah, we've been spotted. Reinforcements. Let's see how well you do with these, Ganatus.
4: Do not move or you will be exterminated.
Daleks, take me to your Commander. I have vital information.
4: Silence.
Why don't you tell them you're their Emperor? I'm sure they'll believe you.
Silence.
4: Silence.
Touch.
4: Patrol five reporting to Dalek Command.
2: Speak.
4 [OC]: Two unidentified humanoids captured.
2: Bring them to Dalek Command for interrogation.
4 [OC]: Patrol six has made visual contact with a blue cuboid object of unknown origin.
2: Order anti-grav units attached to the object. Bring it to Control for full analysis.
4 [OC]: I obey.
What are those Daleks doing out there?
I don't know. I can't quite see. But I wouldn't suggest you go out there to find out. They'd kill you before you had a chance to break that capsule of yours.
Alarm.
What does that mean?
It's the external motion sensor. Yes, look at the scanner. They're moving the Tardis.
2: Enter.
Door opens and closes.
4: These are the prisoners.
2: Identify yourselves.
We are travellers from the future. We have come to help the Daleks, to give you knowledge that will avert a future catastrophe.
(laughing) He's lying. Don't listen to him. We're enemies of the Daleks!
Silence!
2: Time travel is not possible.
Of course it is, you fool. Even now Daleks scientists on Skaro are well
2: Silence! You know nothing of Skaro.
I know everything of Skaro.
2: Silence!
Not as easy as you thought, is it?
2: You will be silent unless answering my direct questions.
Listen to me! I am your Emperor.
2; This human is clearly deranged. Kill it.
I am your Emperor.
(sotto) Well, I'd certainly say you'd got their attention. They almost look frightened. (normal) Interesting trick he does with his voice, isn't it?
2: You are not the Emperor. That is not possible.

Your mission here on Earth is to remove the planet's core and replace it with an interstellar engine. The primary mine shaft for this operation is located in a small landmass five thousand miles from here, in an area known as Bedfordshire.
2: How do you know of this?
Because I formulated the plan. I gave the order for the invasion of Earth. But it is an invasion that will fail because of this man.
(sotto) Now you really are going to have fun explaining this.
2: Explain.
In less than nine years from now, he will arrive in London ina blue box.
2: We have captured a blue box. It is being brought here for analysis.
Yes! That blue box. He will arrive in it in nine years time.
2: But he is here now.
He will defeat the Daleks here on Earth.
2: If what you say is true, we should exterminate him now to prevent this.
Yes, yes, exterminate him now by all means, but that will not prevent him from arriving in 2167.
Don't take any notice of him. He's just trying to confuse you. You've definitely given him some food for thought. You can almost hear his brain ticking over.
2: You will be transported by saucer to the Dalek Supreme Commander on Earth for interrogation. Take them.
4: Move!
No, wait. Stop.
4: Move!
There's something else.
4: Move!
You must listen to me.
4: Move!
Listen! The survival of the Dalek race depends upon it.
2: Speak quickly.
You have a damaged Dalek here. Am I right?
Don't do this, Ganatus. Ganatus, if there is any part of you left in there, don't
Silence! I knew you could not be trusted with this mission. Even now you would let the Mutant Phase consume the Dalek race.
No, but
2: Mutant Phase? What is Mutant Phase?
Something that will destroy the Daleks. Check on the status of the damaged Dalek. I urge you, check now.
2: Dalek Commander to Repair Section. Report on condition of damaged Dalek unit alpha 9.
3 [OC]: Undergoing internal scanning. Alien genetic matter is being detected.
Of course. Don't you see, Ganatus? They've detected it. They've
I am not Ganatus. I am the Emperor of the Daleks, destined to be ruler of the universe!
Destined to put your foot right in it if you don't listen to me.
2: Silence.
3 [OC]: We are preparing procedure to extract alien cells.
Door opens and closes.
4: This is the blue box.
The Tardis.
It's the Doctor and Ganatus.
And those Daleks are about to execute them. There's only one thing we can do.
No, Ptolem! Ah!
Thud.
I'm sorry, Nyssa, there's no other way.
Tardis door opens.
No! Ptolem, wait.
5: Stay where you are. Do not move.
Ptolem, get back in the Tardis.
2: Tardis?
No, Doctor. There's something I must do.
What?
Doctor, he's got a retrovirus in that capsule. He's going to
No, Ptolem, just wait. Please wait. You were right.
Right about what?
Dalek Commander, kill them all and take this.
No!
2: What is it?
It contains a chemical which will destroy the alien cells in that Dalek.
No, Ganatus, don't you see? They've already detected the cells and are going to remove them.
What? What are you saying?
It won't work. The pesticide isn't going to work during this early stage of incubation.
2: Silence.
You're bluffing.
Why on Earth would I do that? We're sitting on one gigantic Time paradox here, and you're the key.
The, the key?
2: Silence!
I thought I was the key, but it's you! The Emperor sealed his own fate.
2: Silence or you will be exterminated.
Drop the injection probe. Drop it! Smash it to pieces.
I, I, I
2: Kill them. Kill them all.
Doctor, I have to do this.
Ptolem, no!
Ptolem, no!
Breaking glass. Time distortion.
Nyssa, get back in the Tardis now!
It's the paradox, isn't it? It's resolving itself.
Yes. Must get to the Tardis.
Normality inside the Tardis.
What about Ptolem and Ganatus? Where are they?
They were never there. And neither were we.
The Tardis dematerialises.
Lots of beeps and the occasional boop.
Doctor?
Shh.
The noises fade.
Safe to talk now?
Hmm. No bump in the Time track. Good. Hmm. Er, yes, safe to talk.
Is it worth asking for some kind of explanation, or will you just start being high-handed and Time Lord-ish again.
Try me.
Where are Ptolem and Ganatus?
Oh, back where they were before they first encountered the Mutant Phase.
I see. And
Go on.
What did you mean when you told Ptolem he was right?
Well, he was the one who suggested our synthesised GK50 might not work.
So in the correct version of history, the Daleks located and extracted the wasp DNA.

It's not so much that there is a correct or incorrect version of history, it's more a matter of the survival of the universe. A paradox was triggered by the Daleks trying to capture the Tardis in their Time corridor. It caused a dangerously high level release of Temporal energy.
Which sort of damaged an already weakened part of the Space Time Continuum, making it what you called a bad place to have a paradox.
Er, sort of. But the Daleks solved the potential problem of the Mutant Phase themselves in 2158, before it even happened, really.
So you mean it never happened?

Er, not quite. You see, the real centre of the paradox which caused the Mutant Phase was triggered by the Emperor Dalek travelling back in time with us, and getting the Daleks to use our GK50 injection probe. The injection would have failed. The genetic mutation would have continued and spread.
But you forced Ganatus to
You mean the Dalek Emperor.
Yes. You forced the Dalek Emperor to realise just in time that he was the one that caused the Mutant Phase.
Yes. Hope for the Daleks yet, isn't there. What's the matter?
That doesn't make sense.
Well, how shall I put it? Paradoxes very rarely do, Nyssa. That's why they're paradoxes.
I suppose you think that's clever.
Er, yes. (chuckling) Yes, I suppose I do, really.
Nyssa chuckles too.
<Back to the 5th Doctor episodes
